businessTitle: Director of PTS Business Support & Governance
jobDescripton: NYC Department of Finance (DOF) is responsible for administering the tax revenue laws of the city fairly, efficiently, and transparently to instill public confidence and encourage compliance while providing exceptional customer service.  The Finance Information Technology (FIT) provides support for all facets of Department of Financeâ€™s computer systems, including hardware, software, applications, and data security.  FIT Division delivers information and technology solutions that the Department of Finance needs to achieve results.   The new Property Tax System (PTS) which administers the City's exemption and abatement programs, collects $23B in property tax revenue. PTS requires creation of a new position to manage the Business Requirements and Quality Assurance processes, as well as the Governance Process related to prioritization, communication and vendor relationship management.    This is a sensitive role dealing with commercial risks and significant costs. The organization must have a high level of confidence in the integrity and track record of the individual appointed to this role.  Without this new position, the agency risks vital oversight and management, system outages, property disaster recovery, and security gaps of critical revenue producing systems. In this role, the Governance/BA/QA Manger will support the Property Valuation, Exemptions and Abatements and Property Tax Billing macro business processes of the DOF.   Responsibilities will include, but is not limited to the following:   â€¢	Develop a formal framework for Governance which ensures the PTS System aligns with business priorities across divisions as enhancements to the new system are prioritized and implemented. â€¢	Facilitating the application governance process to gain consensus on a prioritized set of measurable business outcomes that applications must support. â€¢	Working with stakeholders to define a prioritized set of business outcomes and application work to accomplish those outcomes within the limitations of the application budget. â€¢	Manage testing of production support solutions including scheduling, testing and confirming solutions readiness for production. â€¢	Work with DOF Business Leaders to develop overall PTS systems strategy to support the DOF business re-engineering and operational efficiency initiatives. â€¢	Develop productive relationships with DOF business leaders across Divisions to influence how PTS can enable new sources of value. â€¢	Ensure that PTS system processes (including those of external service providers) are conducted in line with requirements gathering and Quality Testing and applicable standards and          legislation. â€¢	Manage 6-8 BA and QA resources to meet the needs of the organization.  â€¢	Manage relationships with Tyler Technology and other major vendors and service providers to ensure they cost-effectively meet the needs of the organization. â€¢	Support the application organization's successful delivery of these business outcomes in partnership with business colleagues. â€¢	Support operations to automate the handoff of code releases from development to operations. â€¢	Working with the chief information security officer (CISO) to ensure that the organization's applications are effectively secured and that risks are mitigated. â€¢	Present and help manage funding requests to support development of new initiatives â€¢	Engage with procurement and legal contract advisors for additional information. â€¢	Develop and implement policies and procedures. â€¢	Manage Data processing, analysis and quality management tools, IT applications, operations, service and support organizations. â€¢	Support IT contracts and their likely cost implications. â€¢	Responsible for Financial accounting and reporting practices applicable to applications, costs and risks.
minQualRequirements: 1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or  4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in  "1" above.  Qualification Requirements (continued)  NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles.
preferredSkills: â€¢  High levels of personal integrity when conducting the professional affairs of the organization and dealing with sensitive and confidential data relating to risks and costs. â€¢  Calmness and clarity of thought while under pressure. â€¢  Ability to uphold the goals and culture of the organization. â€¢  Ability to lead, enable and motivate teams by providing advice and guidance in a nonjudgmental fashion. â€¢  An understanding of strategic business objectives and the ability to drive results toward those objectives. â€¢  Openness to and the ability to deal with, rapid change in business needs, processes and technologies. â€¢  Strong communication skills with a proven ability to understand key concepts and communicate effectively with technical staff, business stakeholders and senior management. â€¢  Proven ability to communicate technical concepts to nontechnical people to enhance understanding and drive decisions that lead to positive outcomes. â€¢  Proven ability to collaborate, build relationships and influence individuals at all levels in a matrix-management environment (as well as external vendors and service providers) to ensure that     segregation and overlapping roles are identified and coordinated. â€¢  Strong organizational skills, the ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities with competing demands for resources. â€¢  Strong analytical, data-processing and problem-solving skills. â€¢  Proficiency in process formulation and improvement. â€¢  5 years of experience in COTS software deployment and support and integration. â€¢  5 years of demonstrated leadership experience building cross-organizational consensus with exposure to technology providers and/or business clients. â€¢  7 years of demonstrated experience managing a high-performing, cohesive team. â€¢  5 years of demonstrated experience in liaising with middle and senior management.
additionalInformation: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.  NOTE: THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO APPLICANTS WHO HAVE TAKEN THE OPEN COMPETITIVE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER EXAM #9011, OR THOSE WHO ARE ALREADY PERMANENT IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER TITLE. PLEASE INDICATE IN YOUR COVER LETTER IF YOU HAVE TAKEN THE EXAM OR ALREADY PERMANENT IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER TITLE.  THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO QUALIFIED PERSONS WITH A DISABILITY WHO ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THE 55-A PROGRAM. PLEASE INDICATE ON YOUR RESUME OR COVER LETTER IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THE POSITION UNDER THE 55-A PROGRAM.

jobDescripton: The Home Care Services Program is responsible for Medicaid-funded non-institutional long-term care programs in New York City. Programs include the Personal Care Services Program, the Long Term Home Health Care Program, the Assisted Living Program, the Care at Home Program, and the Managed Long Term Care Program. Managed long-term care (MLTC) assists people who are chronically ill or have disabilities and need health and long-term care services, such as home care or adult day care, stay in their homes and communities as long as possible.  The Home Care Services Program is recruiting for one (1) Staff Nurse, to function as Staff Nurse in the Manhattan CASA office who will: â€¢	Conduct in-home assessments at the  request of HRA using a State approved assessment instrument to evaluate the clientâ€™s ability to perform activities of daily living and the degree to which the client requires assistance for each function and task; the completed assessment would be entered into the New York State Department of Health (NYDOH) or HRA computer system;  â€¢	Assist in determining the level of home care services or other services of care that the client needs based on the medical diagnosis and degree of functional impairment. The development of the plan of care must take into consideration clientâ€™s home environment and social support system;  â€¢	Complete home visits and submit the completed HRA/NYSDOH approved assessments and recommendations forms no later than five (5) workdays after the date of assignment;   â€¢	Conduct case reviews of new applicants, service change and re-authorization cases, and participate in special projects. The review consists of screening all documents related to the request for service and may include contacting the clientâ€™s physician or other resources for additional medical documentation and information as necessary;   â€¢	Develop a plan of care for the type and amount of home care services to be provided to the client after reviewing all required case documentation;   â€¢	Prepare documentation for and testify at Fair Hearings and at other legal proceedings to explain clinical findings and determinations regarding the plan of care;  â€¢	Provide consultation to HRA Medical Review Team and social service staff at HRAâ€™s request;    â€¢	Complete self-audits of state approved assessments and medical review of charts; and   â€¢	Work toward obtaining PRI/screen certification and conduct assessments of clients transitioning to a Nursing Home Facility.
minQualRequirements: 1. A valid New York State Registered Nurse License.
preferredSkills: â€¢	Must be able to communicate verbally and in writing;   â€¢	Must be able to utilize computer programs and enter data in an electronic field visit report;   â€¢	Prefer applicants with bilingual ability.

jobDescripton: The NYC Department of Buildings is responsible for ensuring the safe and lawful use of buildings and properties by enforcing the NYC Construction Codes, Energy Code and Zoning Resolution. We facilitate compliant development with integrity, efficiency and professionalism. We are committed to becoming a premier municipal building organization, dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for all New Yorkers and making our city safer. We are committed to improving our performance and developing procedures that are streamlined, understandable and transparent. This position performs work in the inspection of construction, repairs or alteration of structures for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications.  Under general supervision:   â€¢ Performs technical inspections of construction work pursuant to applications filed with the Department of Buildings. These applications involve the erection, alteration, and repair of structures throughout the city. The inspector is to determine if construction work is being done safely and in conformance with approved applications, plans, and specifications in accordance with the NYC Construction Code, Zoning Resolution, or other pertinent laws and rules enforced by the Department of Buildings.  â€¢ Responds to, reports and investigates accidents, incidents and complaints for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications. Studies drawings to obtain details for inspections.  â€¢ Issues violations, summonses and stop work orders.  â€¢ Verifies licenses of onsite workers.   â€¢ When issuing violations, advises the recipient of the nature of the violating condition.   â€¢ Testifies as needed, including at ECB, depositions, and court.  â€¢ Maintains records and makes reports.  â€¢ Explains and enforces laws and rules relevant to the field.   â€¢ May assign, supervise, review and evaluate work of subordinates.   â€¢ May train subordinates in their duties.  â€¢ May review applications relevant to the field.  â€¢ May assist supervisor.  â€¢ Operates a motor vehicle in the performance of assigned duties.   Some of the physical activities performed by Inspectors (Construction) and environmental conditions experienced are: walking to and from inspection sites and, during the course of inspections, climbing and descending ladders and stairs to get to areas to be inspected; standing on scaffolds to inspect work; standing for extended periods of time; working in confined areas; wearing hard hats; bending and stooping during inspections; climbing over and around various objects; walking in areas that may be damp, dark, dusty, smoky or acrid; and working outdoors in all kinds of weather.  Special Working Conditions: Inspectors (Construction) may be required to work shifts including nights, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  Candidates must successfully pass a drug screening to be appointed.
minQualRequirements: 1. Five years of full-time, satisfactory experience working in the construction trades as a carpenter, mason, ironworker, plasterer, architect, engineer, building construction superintendent, or inspector of building construction; or  2. A license as a professional engineer or registered architect issued pursuant to the New York State Education law; or  3. Three years of full-time, satisfactory experience as described in "1" above, and two years of formal training or education in an acceptable construction program, given in a college accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) or a technical school or trade school approved by a stateâ€™s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization; or  4. Three years of participation in the apprentice construction inspection program offered by the Department of Buildings, and either two years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "1" above, or two years of formal training or education as described in "3" above.     Experience not considered acceptable: working as a home-improvement contractor (e.g., doing siding, roofing and painting), sheet metal worker, shipbuilder, metal lather, Sheetrock taper, glazier, insulation installer.    Driver License Requirement: At the time of appointment to this position, you must have a motor vehicle driver license valid in the State of New York. If you have moving violations, license suspension or an accident record, you may be disqualified. This license must be maintained for the duration of your employment.
preferredSkills: Working knowledge of the NYC Construction Codes and Zoning Resolution Computer literacy
additionalInformation: You must have a motor vehicle driver license valid in the State of New York. If you have moving violations, license suspension or an accident record, you may be disqualified. jobDescripton: The NYC Department of Buildings is responsible for ensuring the safe and lawful use of buildings and properties by enforcing the NYC Construction Codes, Energy Code and Zoning Resolution. We facilitate compliant development with integrity, efficiency and professionalism. We are committed to becoming a premier municipal building organization, dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for all New Yorkers and making our city safer. We are committed to improving our performance and developing procedures that are streamlined, understandable and transparent.  This position performs work in the inspection of plumbing installations, repairs or alterations for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications.  Under general supervision:  â€¢ Performs technical inspections of installations and repairs of plumbing, gas and fire suppression systems (including sprinklers and standpipes) for compliance with the NYC Construction Code, Zoning Resolution, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications. Such systems include underground, roughing-in, finish, equipment, fixtures, components, fire pumps and house connections and appurtenances.   â€¢ Responds to, reports and investigates accidents, incidents and complaints for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications.  â€¢ Witnesses tests on drainage, water, air, gas, sprinkler, standpipe and fire pump for violations of the plumbing or fire suppression codes, or illegal practices.  â€¢ Studies drawings to obtain details for inspections.  â€¢ Issues violations, summonses and stop work orders.  â€¢ Verifies licenses of onsite workers.  â€¢ When issuing violations, advises the recipient of the nature of the violating condition.  â€¢ Testifies as needed, including at ECB, depositions, and court.   â€¢ Maintains records and makes reports.  â€¢ Explains and enforces laws and rules relevant to the field.  â€¢ May assign, supervise, review and evaluate work of subordinates.   â€¢ May train subordinates in their duties.  â€¢ May review applications relevant to the field.  â€¢ May assist supervisor.  â€¢ May operate a motor vehicle in the performance of assigned duties.   Some of the physical activities performed by Inspectors (Plumbing) and environmental conditions experienced are: walking to and from inspection sites and during inspections; climbing and descending ladders and stairs to get to areas which must be inspected; standing for extended period of time; maintaining balance while walking over narrow walkways or areas that are elevated; climbing around and over various objects; working in areas that may be damp, dusty, dark, smoky or acrid.  Special Working Conditions: Inspectors may be required to work shifts including nights, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  Candidates must successfully pass a drug screening to be appointed.
minQualRequirements: 1. Five years of full-time satisfactory mechanical experience as a plumber in the installation of plumbing systems; or  2. Three years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in â€œ1" above plus two years of education in an accredited college, technical school or trade school in a program, with an emphasis on plumbing; or  3. Satisfactory completion of the three-year apprenticeship plumbing inspection program approved by the Commissioner of Buildings and the Commissioner of the Department of Citywide Administrative Services and either two years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in â€œ1" above or two years of education as described in â€œ2" above; or  4. A license as a professional engineer or architect valid in the State of New York.
preferredSkills: Experience or training in the design of Plumbing and Fire Sprinkler/Standpipe systems Working knowledge of the NYC Construction Codes Computer literacy
additionalInformation: At the time of appointment to this position, you must have a motor vehicle driver license valid in the State of New York. If you have moving violations, license suspension or an accident record, you may be disqualified. This license must be maintained for the duration of your employment.   At the time of appointment, all candidates residing in New York City must apply to receive Special Patrolman status  Unit assignment and work location are based on operational need. Transfers may occur at any time with sufficient notice.  Please note:  This positions is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a program.  Please indicate on your resume or cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a Program.

jobDescripton: The NYC Department of Homeless Services (DHS) is one of the largest organizations of its kind committed to preventing and addressing homelessness in New York City. Collaborating with other public agencies and not-for-profit partners, the DHS works to prevent homelessness before it occurs, reduce street homelessness and assist New Yorkers to transition from shelter into appropriate permanent housing.   The NYC Department of Homeless Services, Facilities & Logistics division is hiring three (3) RSRI (Routine Site Review Inspections) Space Analyst that will report directly to the Director of Facility Maintenance or their designee. The RSRI Space Analyst will conduct Routine Site Review Inspections at 600 + Shelters, which involves coordinated inspections with the NYC Department of Buildings, NYC Fire Department, NYC Housing Preservation & Development, NYC Department of Health & Mental Hygiene and the Office of Temporary Disability Assistance. The RSRI Space Analyst takes part in other types of inspections with groups like the Coalition for the Homeless, which conduct Callahan Inspections. In addition, the RSRI Space Analyst works closely with DHS providers on other facilities/constructions tasks.  The Space Analysts will:  â€¢ Conduct field assessments related to outstanding building violations throughout     the five (5) boroughs  â€¢ Discuss with DHS providers outstanding building violations and ensure DHS   providers make all necessary repairs and submit back up documentation  â€¢ Oversee DHS general contractors in necessary facility repairs  â€¢ Coordinate with consultants and/or in-house staff and manage other projects   from conception to completion  â€¢ Manually enter violation data received in PDF format from issuing agencies  â€¢ Research building violations by going to different agency websites or    other databases  â€¢ Perform additional duties related to the tasks listed above including assisting   the division in other administrative/ facilities related assignments  â€¢ May work as a team leader and other special assignments
minQualRequirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), and one year of satisfactory, full-time experience in the evaluation and layout of space in office buildings, garages and other structures used for commercial and industrial purposes. Such experience must have included projects requiring knowledge of construction needs and cost, installation of computer equipment and telephone communication systems, and building standards and leasing procedures; or  2. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a Stateâ€™s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization, and five years of satisfactory, full-time experience, as described in â€œ1â€ above. College education obtained from an accredited college or university accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), may be substituted for up to four years of experience on the basis of 30 semester credits for one year. However, all candidates must have one year of experience described in â€œ1â€ above.  To be qualified for assignment to Assignment Level II, individuals must have two additional years of the experience described in "1" above, as follows:  a) A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, and three years of satisfactory, full-time experience as described in "1" above; or  b) A four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and seven years of satisfactory, full-time experience, as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: â€¢ Background with DOB, FDNY and HPD violations â€¢ Proficiency with MS Office applications â€¢ Ability to communicate professionally with internal and external partners,   via email and verbal. â€¢ Ability to apply creative solutions
additionalInformation: THE SALARY RANGE FOR THIS POSITION IS $55,416.00 - $63,728.00  **LOAN FORGIVENESS The federal government provides student loan forgiveness through its Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF) to all qualifying public service employees. Working with the DSS/HRA/DHS qualifies you as a public service employee and you may be able to take advantage of this program while working full-time and meeting the programâ€™s other requirements.   Please visit the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program site to view the eligibility requirements:  https://studentaid.ed.gov/sa/repay-loans/forgiveness-cancellation/public-service
toApply: For City Employees, please go to Employee Self Service (ESS), click on Recruiting Activities/Careers. For all other applicants, please go to NYC Careers by using the following link http://www1.nyc.gov/jobs. Most public libraries have computers available for use. No phone calls, faxes, e-mails and personal inquiries permitted.
residencyRequirement: New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

jobDescripton: The NYC Department of Homeless Services (DHS) is one of the largest organizations of its kind committed to preventing and addressing homelessness in New York City. Collaborating with other public agencies and not-for-profit partners, the DHS works to prevent homelessness before it occurs, reduce street homelessness and assist New Yorkers to transition from shelter into appropriate permanent housing.   The NYC Department of Homeless Services, Facilities & Logistics division is hiring one (1) RSRI (Routine Site Review Inspections) Space Analyst that will report directly to the Director of Facility Maintenance or their designee. The RSRI Space Analyst will conduct Routine Site Review Inspections at 600 + Shelters, which involves coordinated inspections with the NYC Department of Buildings, NYC Fire Department, NYC Housing Preservation & Development, NYC Department of Health & Mental Hygiene and the Office of Temporary Disability Assistance. The RSRI Space Analyst takes part in other types of inspections with groups like the Coalition for the Homeless, which conduct Callahan Inspections. In addition, the RSRI Space Analyst works closely with DHS providers on other facilities/constructions tasks.   The Space Analyst will:   â€¢ Conduct field assessments related to outstanding building violations throughout    the five (5) boroughs  â€¢ Discuss with DHS providers outstanding building violations and ensure DHS   providers make all necessary repairs and submit back up documentation.  â€¢ Oversee DHS general contractors in necessary facility repairs.  â€¢ Coordinate with consultants and/or in-house staff and manage other projects   from conception to completion.  â€¢ Manually enter violation data received in PDF format from issuing agencies  â€¢ Research building violations by going to different agency websites or other databases  â€¢ Perform additional duties related to the tasks listed above including assisting   the division in other administrative/ facilities related assignments.  â€¢ May work as a team leader and other special assignments
minQualRequirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), and one year of satisfactory, full-time experience in the evaluation and layout of space in office buildings, garages and other structures used for commercial and industrial purposes. Such experience must have included projects requiring knowledge of construction needs and cost, installation of computer equipment and telephone communication systems, and building standards and leasing procedures; or  2. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a Stateâ€™s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization, and five years of satisfactory, full-time experience, as described in â€œ1â€ above. College education obtained from an accredited college or university accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), may be substituted for up to four years of experience on the basis of 30 semester credits for one year. However, all candidates must have one year of experience described in â€œ1â€ above.  To be qualified for assignment to Assignment Level II, individuals must have two additional years of the experience described in "1" above, as follows:  a) A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college, and three years of satisfactory, full-time experience as described in "1" above; or  b) A four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and seven years of satisfactory, full-time experience, as described in "1" above.

jobDescripton: The NYC Department of Buildings is responsible for ensuring the safe and lawful use of buildings and properties by enforcing the NYC Construction Codes, Energy Code and Zoning Resolution. We facilitate compliant development with integrity, efficiency and professionalism. We are committed to becoming a premier municipal building organization, dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for all New Yorkers and making our city safer. We are committed to improving our performance and developing procedures that are streamlined, understandable and transparent. This position performs work in the inspection of electrical installations, repairs or alterations for conformity with NYC Construction Codes, Electrical Code, Department rules, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications.  Under general supervision:  â€¢ Performs technical inspections electrical installations in connection with light, heat or power for buildings and other structures for compliance with the New York building and electrical codes, other pertinent laws and rules, and approved plans and specifications. â€¢ Makes periodic inspections of electrical wiring in combustible occupancies and places of public assembly.  â€¢ Performs joint inspections with FDNY at scenes of fires and other accidents regarding potential electrical defect.  â€¢ Inspects scenes of fires or accidents to determine whether violations of NYC Construction Codes, Electrical Code, Department rules, and other pertinent laws and rules are present. â€¢ Investigates complaints of defective electrical installations which are reported as fire, shock or other hazard and issues verbal or written instructions for correction.  â€¢ Studies drawings to obtain details for inspections. â€¢ Explains and enforces electrical standards, and laws and rules relevant to the field. â€¢ Issues violations, summonses, and stop work orders.  â€¢ Verifies licenses of onsite workers.  â€¢ When issuing violations, advises the recipient of the nature of the violating condition.  â€¢ Testifies as needed, including at ECB, depositions, and court.  â€¢ Maintains records and makes reports.  â€¢ May assign, supervise, review and evaluate work of subordinates.  â€¢ May review applications relevant to the field.  â€¢ May assist supervisor.  Some of the physical activities performed by Inspectors (Electrical) and environmental conditions experienced are: driving vehicles to and from inspection sites; walking to and from inspection sites and during inspections; climbing and descending ladders and stairs to get to areas which must be inspected; standing for extended periods of time; maintaining balance while walking over narrow walkways or areas that are elevated; climbing around and over various objects; and working in areas that may be damp, dusty, dark, smoky or acrid.  Special Working Conditions: Inspectors (Electrical) may be required to work shifts including nights, Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  Candidates must successfully pass a drug screening in order to be appointed.
minQualRequirements: 1. Five years of full-time satisfactory experience acquired within the last 15 years as an electrician or inspector of electrical installations, light, heat, and/or power distribution, fire alarm detection or communication systems; or  2. Three years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in â€œ1â€ above, plus either 60 semester credits from an accredited college with a minimum of 12 credits in electrical related courses or two years of full-time training in an acceptable electrical program in an accredited technical school; or  3. A license as a professional engineer or architect valid in the State of New York; or  4. A satisfactory combination of education and/or experience that is equivalent to â€œ1â€ or â€œ2â€ above. Education may be substituted for experience on the basis that six months of full-time training in an electrical program in an accredited technical school or 15 semester credits in an accredited college is equivalent to six months of the experience described in â€œ1â€ above. To be credited, college education must include at least 12 semester credits in electrical related courses. However, all candidates must have a minimum of three years of experience as described in â€œ1â€ above.    Driver License Requirement: By the time you are appointed to this position, you must have a motor vehicle driver license valid in the State of New York. If you have moving violations, license suspension(s) or an accident record, you may be disqualified. This license must be maintained for the duration of your employment.  Medical Requirement: Medical guidelines have been established for the position of Inspector (Electrical). Candidates will be examined to determine whether they can perform the essential functions of the position of Inspector (Electrical). Where appropriate, a reasonable accommodation will be provided for a person with a disability to enable him or her to take the examination, and /or to perform the essential functions of the job.

businessTitle: Director of Information Management IT Systems
jobDescripton: NYC Department of Finance (DOF) is responsible for administering the tax revenue laws of the city fairly, efficiently, and transparently to instill public confidence and encourage compliance while providing exceptional customer service.  Finance Information Technology (FIT) provides support for all facets of Department of Financeâ€™s computer systems, including hardware, software, applications, and data security.  FIT Division delivers information and technology solutions that the Department of Finance needs to achieve results.   The Chief Information Officer of Finance Information Technology seeks a Director of Information Management IT Systems for multiple responsibilities.  The selected candidate in this role should be experienced in Enterprise Information Management (EIM) best practices and be able to execute a plan to manage the organization's data needs.  In addition, a strong background in project management and data warehousing is required. The purpose of this role is to execute DOF's EIM strategy to achieve DOF's Data Vision.  Duties and responsibilities will include, but not limited to the following:  Vision â€¢	Formulate and articulate the organization's data vision. â€¢	Market and gain acceptance of this vision.  Strategy â€¢	Formulate and articulate the process and steps to achieve the vision. â€¢	Execute the strategy by collaborating with multiple teams.  Governance â€¢	Assist in the implementation of a Governance Committee. â€¢	Provide technical input to the Governance Committee.  Metrics â€¢	Educate data consumers on the need for Metrics (to gauge progress). â€¢	Emphasize the capture of metrics during projects.  Data Life Cycle â€¢       Understand the data life cycle of the various business units. â€¢       Be able to translate the data life cycle into a scalable data model.  Defining Organization and Roles â€¢	Advocate for the proper roles to be in place to achieve the agency's data projects. â€¢	Define the difference in the data roles to senior management.  Technology and Infrastructure â€¢	Advise on and implement the correct technology to use for data management and business intelligence. â€¢	Offer direction on the technology footprint for the long-term.
minQualRequirements: 1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or  4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in  "1" above.  Qualification Requirements (continued)  NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles.
preferredSkills: â€¢      A minimum of 15 years of experience with:  DataStage, Oracle, Cognos, Tivoli, Scripting, SQL, Performance Tuning, Data Warehousing, SDLC and Managing Large Scale IT projects. â€¢      Experience in Enterprise Information Management (EIM) best practices â€¢      Ability to execute a plan to manage an organization's data needs by working with internal and external users.   â€¢      A strong background in IT project management and data warehousing is critical. â€¢      Excellent Database Design, Development and Performance Tuning. â€¢      Strong collaboration and communication (oral and written) skills. The candidate must be able to work well with his/her peers, users and management. â€¢      Ability to translate user requirements into clear visualizations.  This implies familiarity with various types of visualizations available in Cognos. â€¢      Knowledge of Microsoft Office tools suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
additionalInformation: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.  NOTE: THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO APPLICANTS WHO HAVE TAKEN THE OPEN COMPETITIVE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER EXAM #9011, OR THOSE WHO ARE ALREADY PERMANENT IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER TITLE.  PLEASE INDICATE IN YOUR COVER LETTER IF YOU HAVE TAKEN THE EXAM OR ALREADY PERMANENT IN THE COMPUTER SYSTEMS MANAGER TITLE.  THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO QUALIFIED PERSONS WITH A DISABILITY WHO ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THE 55-A PROGRAM. PLEASE INDICATE ON YOUR RESUME OR COVER LETTER IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THE POSITION UNDER THE 55-A PROGRAM.

jobDescripton: The Human Resources unit coordinates all aspects of employee relations and organizational culture, which includes but is not limited to the management of recruitment, onboarding, payroll, timekeeping and benefits processes. The unit is seeking an experienced manager to support with all aspects of the unitâ€™s operations. Under the direction of the Deputy Commissioner, Administration and Finance, and the Assistant Commissioner, Human Resources, the Director will:     â€¢	Oversee the day-to-day operational procedures and processes of the unit, including but not limited to: recruitment, onboarding, benefits, payroll and timekeeping â€¢	Coordinate the appointment, transfer, promotion and resignation of employees â€¢	Interface with management regarding the status of personnel actions and required approvals â€¢	Partner with the Assistant Commissioner of Human Resources to promote employee-centered initiatives while fostering a equitable and inclusive environment â€¢	Assist in the coordination of all EEO related activities  The selected candidate will be assigned to periodic Emergency Operations Center team and will be expected to work non-business hours during emergencies. The selected candidate will also participate in drills and exercises, assist with Ready NY presentations to external groups, and will undertake special projects as assigned.
minQualRequirements: 1. A masterâ€™s degree from an accredited college in emergency management, public administration, urban planning, engineering, economics, political science, the physical sciences, or related field, and three years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: emergency management, fire or police services, public safety, public health, public administration, urban planning, engineering, or another specialized area to which the appointment is to be made. 18 months of this experience must have been in an executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory capacity. Supervision must have included supervising staff performing professional work in the areas described above; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the areas listed in "1" above, including the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and eight years satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the areas described in "1" above, including the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above; or  4. Education and/or experience equivalent to "1", "2", or "3" above. However, all candidates must have a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: â€¢	A minimum of three years of professional managerial and supervisory human resources experience â€¢	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of employees â€¢	Strong analytical skills and ability to research complex issues â€¢	Detail oriented and self-motivated â€¢	Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel  â€¢	Knowledge of Citywide policies a plus

Under the direction of the Deputy Commissioner, Administration and Finance, and the Assistant Commissioner, Human Resources, the Director will:     â€¢	Oversee the day-to-day operational procedures and processes of the unit, including but not limited to: recruitment, onboarding, benefits, payroll and timekeeping â€¢	Coordinate the appointment, transfer, promotion and resignation of employees â€¢	Interface with management regarding the status of personnel actions and required approvals â€¢	Partner with the Assistant Commissioner of Human Resources to promote employee-centered initiatives while fostering a equitable and inclusive environment â€¢	Assist in the coordination of all EEO related activities  The selected candidate will be assigned to periodic Emergency Operations Center team and will be expected to work non-business hours during emergencies. The selected candidate will also participate in drills and exercises, assist with Ready NY presentations to external groups, and will undertake special projects as assigned.
minQualRequirements: 1. A masterâ€™s degree from an accredited college in emergency management, public administration, urban planning, engineering, economics, political science, the physical sciences, or related field, and three years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: emergency management, fire or police services, public safety, public health, public administration, urban planning, engineering, or another specialized area to which the appointment is to be made. 18 months of this experience must have been in an executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory capacity. Supervision must have included supervising staff performing professional work in the areas described above; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the areas listed in "1" above, including the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and eight years satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the areas described in "1" above, including the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above; or  4. Education and/or experience equivalent to "1", "2", or "3" above. However, all candidates must have a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: â€¢	A minimum of three years of professional managerial and supervisory human resources experience â€¢	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of employees â€¢	Strong analytical skills and ability to research complex issues â€¢	Detail oriented and self-motivated â€¢	Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel  â€¢	Knowledge of Citywide policies a plus

jobDescripton: New York City Emergency Management (NYC EM) helps New Yorkers before, during, and after emergencies through preparedness, education, and response. NYC EM is responsible for coordinating citywide emergency planning and response for all types and scales of emergencies. We are staffed by more than 200 dedicated professionals with diverse backgrounds and areas of expertise, including individuals assigned from other City agencies.  The NYCEM Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Unit produces reliable location-based information through the integration, analysis, and visualization of essential data distributed in the form of maps, datasets, summary metrics, and associated applications.    NYCEM has an exciting opportunity for a motivated GIS professional to join the Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Division at New York City Emergency Management (NYCEM). The selected applicant will be the GIS Mitigation Program Manager within the Public Safety GIS Data Development Center team with a focus on providing data support for agency mitigation planning efforts.  Under the supervision of the Executive Director, Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Deputy Director, Public Safety GIS Data Development Center, the selected applicant will work to analyze, visualize and report on geospatial information to support the work of the agencyâ€™s executive, planning, and operations staff. The Program Manager will have responsibility for supporting Hazard Mitigation activities, including support for OneNYC and Hazard Mitigation Plan mapping, data acquisition, clean up and management for the Hazard History and Consequences Tool, and supporting the Interim Flood Protection Measures Program. The Program Manager will be responsible for maintaining maps and geospatial data on the Hazard Mitigation Plan website, and assisting in the creation of new tools and applications for mitigation planning. The GIS Mitigation Program Manager will also perform data acquisition, QA/QC, data maintenance, and data management tasks on the Public Safety GIS Data Center team.  The candidate will also research, develop, and maintain a georeferenced database to assist in documenting the history of hazards and impacts in the City, e.g., flooding, power outages, service disruptions, damages, etc., for reference in developing grant applications. The candidate will coordinate projects and applications to assist City agencies in reporting damage, preparing applications, and tracking status for Hazards Mitigation Grant Program projects.  The selected applicant will work on GIS tools, including Python tools for desktop and Enterprise GIS, make map templates, paper maps, and web maps in support of NYCEM-coordinated mitigation and resiliency projects. The successful applicant will also liaise with partner agencies to support data sharing and coordination of mitigation projects. In addition, the selected applicant will:  â€¢	Identify and acquire historical and newly developed mitigation and resiliency project data  â€¢	Manage data and mapping support for NYC Hazard Mitigation Plan mitigation actions  â€¢	Run HAZUS-MH to produce hazard scenario loss estimation data and maps â€¢	Perform ETL, data processing, QA/QC, metadata creation and related processes to operate and maintain the Public Safety GIS Data Catalog â€¢	Enhance data management capabilities by automating data acquisition, QA/QC, and data management tasks  â€¢	Develop custom templates for presentation of geospatial and time-series data â€¢	Make and use maps and map templates to fulfill NYCEM mapping requests    â€¢	Develop dashboards and data visualization applications for GIS and Hazard Mitigation data      â€¢	Accept ad hoc rapid data acquisition, mapping, time-series analysis, and reporting requests   The selected candidate will be assigned to periodic Emergency Operations Center team and will be expected to work non-business hours during emergencies. The selected candidate will also participate in drills and exercises, assist with Ready NY presentations to external groups, and will undertake special projects as assigned.
minQualRequirements: 1. A masterâ€™s degree from an accredited college in emergency management, public administration, urban planning, engineering, economics, political science, the physical sciences or related field and one year of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: emergency management, fire, police, or military service, public safety, public health, public administration, urban planning, engineering, or another specialized area to which the appointment is to be made; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the areas listed in â€œ1â€ above; or  3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a stateâ€™s  department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and six years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in the areas listed in â€œ1â€ above, at least two years of which must have been in one of those areas, or another specialized area to which the appointment is to be made.
preferredSkills: â€¢	Demonstrated proficiency with Esri desktop products (version 10x) â€¢	Demonstrated experience working with geospatial data types â€¢	Demonstrated experience with statistical analysis software and programming including Tableau, R, SAS â€¢	Experience working with ArcGIS Online and ArcGIS Enterprise (Server, Portal, SDE DataStore, Web AppBuilder) â€¢	Experience with Python and ArcPy â€¢	Demonstrated skills and experience with cartography and graphic design for geospatial information â€¢	Experience with MS SQL Server 2012 â€¢	Familiarity with FEMAâ€™s HAZUS-MH platform a plus â€¢	Familiarity with ArcGIS Online capabilities and GIS application development. â€¢	Ability to thrive in agile, fast-paced mapping and data management environment â€¢	Demonstrated experience working with technical and non-technical staff â€¢	Strong initiative and ability to perform with little supervision â€¢	Ability to identify needs of end users and communicate possible solutions to them â€¢	Strong organizational skills â€¢	Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines â€¢	Ability to work in a team environment
additionalInformation: THIS POSITION IS GRANT FUNDED THROUGH 8/31/2020 WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF AN EXTENSION

businessTitle: Director of Human Resources and Administration
jobCategory: Administration & Human Resources Finance, Accounting, & Procurement Policy, Research & Analysis
jobDescripton: The Board is seeking an experienced, highly motivated, and innovative manager to develop and lead the agencyâ€™s personnel, budgetary, and procurement operations. The Director of Human Resources and Administration will report directly to the General Counselâ€™s Office and the Executive Team to ensure the agency has sound personnel and financial practices in place to support a healthy workplace and the responsible administration of government resources.  Responsibilities will include: â€¢	Supervising a staff of 1-2 people, including the Office Manager; â€¢	Oversight of daily HR operations, including advising employees on agency and city policies and benefits; â€¢	Acting as the primary resource for the Executive Team to navigate Human Resource processes including recruitment, managing/operating within the Civil Service System, employee skill development, employee separation, discipline, and benefit provision; â€¢	Serving as Agency Chief Contracting Officer (ACCO) and lead agency procurement efforts; â€¢	Managing annual agency budget and liaise with NYC Office of Management and Budget (OMB); â€¢	Coordinating with NYC Department of Citywide Administrative Services (DCAS) and NYC Department of Correction (DOC) as necessary to address physical workspace issues; â€¢	Managing the employee recruitment process, including screening applications and working with hiring managers to identify, select, and retain diverse staff and ensure equitable hiring and retention practices; â€¢	Managing employee onboarding processes, including new employee orientations; â€¢	Managing and directing employee relations activities, including conferring with employees on matters concerning personnel problems, procedures, and grievances, addressing staff conflict, and making systemic agency recommendations to improve employee relations; â€¢	Managing agency timekeeping and payroll functions; â€¢	Developing and implementing systems for tracking employee attendance, including leave and lateness; â€¢	Maintaining compliance with collective bargaining units and their representatives; â€¢	Coordinating the development of Tasks and Standards for all employees, and developing and managing an annual performance evaluation process, ensuring regular conferences between supervisors and staff; â€¢	Managing agency EEO compliance and complaint investigations (for which incumbent will report directly to the Executive Director); â€¢	Leading and/or coordinating with DCAS to provide employee training related to critical personnel matters, including training on EEO issues, supervisory training, and training on agency and city policies; â€¢	Conducting employee exit interviews and advising on employee separation matters; â€¢	On a continual basis, analyzing existing policies and processes to determine whether desired outcomes are being achieved and make recommendations as necessary to improve upon existing practices.
minQualRequirements: 1. A master's degree from an accredited college in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, urban studies or a closely related field, and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, employee benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation, or fiscal management; or in a related area. 18 months of this experience must have been in an executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory capacity. Supervision must have included supervising staff performing professional work in the areas described above; or  2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of professional experience in the areas described in "1" above, including the 18 months of executive, managerial, administrative or supervisory experience, as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: Preferred Skills  â€¢	â€œCan Do!â€ positive attitude; â€¢	Proven experience leading the Human Resources/Budget function of a New York City agency; â€¢	Thorough knowledge of City Personnel, Payroll and Timekeeping procedures and policies; â€¢	Demonstrated experience promoting workplace diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), including facilitation of DEI trainings and/or making recommendations to ensure an inclusive work environment; â€¢	Strong working knowledge of DEI best practices with an understanding of city government cultural issues as well as emerging trends;  â€¢	Proven commitment to valuing and respecting diversity in the workplace; â€¢	Enthusiasm at the prospect of developing new systems in a small but growing City agency;  â€¢	Experience overseeing workplace conflict resolution and employee discipline; â€¢	Familiarity with City EEO, Labor Relations, Management policies, Training and Safety and Health rules and issues; â€¢	Excellent knowledge of NYC personnel systems, including NYCAPS, CHRMS, RMDS, PMS, CityTime, PRISE, PI, Workers Compensation; â€¢	Familiarity with Comptroller Directives, Procurement Policy Board Rules, and DCAS Purchasing Guidelines; â€¢	Familiarity with FMS2 and 3, PASSPort, and Office of Citywide Procurement system; â€¢	Excellent writing and communication skills; â€¢	Strong analytic and strategic planning skills; â€¢	Excellent interpersonal and team skills; â€¢	Ability to work independently and lead others; â€¢	Well-organized with excellent attention to detail; â€¢	Ability to work under pressure.
additionalInformation: Appointments are subject to Office of Management and Budget approval.  The City of New York and the Board of Correction is an equal opportunity employer and committed to diversity.  Submission of an application does not guarantee an interview. Only candidates under consideration will be contacted.  About the New York City Board of Correction The New York City Board of Correction (BOC) is a nine-person, non-judicial oversight board, which regulates, monitors, and inspects the correctional facilities of the City. Established in 1957, BOC is one of the earliest independent oversight boards of custodial and detention settings in the United States. The Mayor, City Council and presiding justices of the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court for the First and Second Judicial Departments (in joint nomination with the Mayor) appoint its members. The City Charter mandates the Boardâ€™s five functions: â€¢	Establish and ensure compliance with minimum standards for the care, custody, correction, treatment, supervision, and discipline of all persons held or confined under the jurisdiction of the Department of Correction; â€¢	Investigate serious incidents; â€¢	Review grievances from inmates and staff; â€¢	Evaluate the performance of the Department of Correction; and, â€¢	Make recommendations on areas of key correctional planning.  The Board established the Minimum Standards on jail conditions in 1979, on mental health care in 1985, and on health care in 1991. In 2007, BOC finished a comprehensive review of the Minimum Standards and adopted a series of amendments. In 2015-2016, the Board promulgated rules codifying ground-breaking criminal justice reforms. This included the Cityâ€™s ending of punitive segregation for 16-21 year olds and individuals with serious physical/mental health disabilities. In late 2016, the Board enacted a new chapter of its Minimum Standards that are based on national standards underlying the federal Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA). These new rules require action which is specifically tailored to detecting, preventing and responding to sexual abuse and sexual harassment in the Cityâ€™s jails. Recently, BOC commenced rulemaking on restrictive housing and going forward, will update its Mental Health Minimum Standards.  Over the past two years, to expand its research, monitoring and rule-making efforts, the Board has nearly doubled its annual budget to $ 3 million and its staff to 28 (with planned expansion to 36). With offices in lower Manhattan and Rikers Island, BOC works regularly with the Department of Correction and Health + Hospitals, and often with other government and   external partners, on a wide variety of criminal justice issues germane to its oversight responsibilities. The Board brings to this work a strong emphasis on data-sharing, data-driven decision making and public reporting. In keeping with major reforms occurring at the national, state and local level, the Board recently re-envisioned its mission: to carry out independent oversight and enact regulation in support of safer, fairer, smaller and more humane jails.
toApply: For City employees: Go to Employee Self-Service (ESS) - www.nyc.gov/ess and search for Job ID #399528   Please submit a resume and cover letter. A writing sample may be requested if you are contacted for an interview.     Please indicate in your cover letter where you learned of this career opportunity.  Submission of a resume is not a guarantee that you will receive an interview. Only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
workLocation1: One Centre St. Room 2213 NY, NY 10007, with periodic travel to the BOC office on Rikers Island

In keeping with major reforms occurring at the national, state and local level, the Board recently re-envisioned its mission: to carry out independent oversight and enact regulation in support of safer, fairer, smaller and more humane jails.

jobCategory: Constituent Services & Community Programs Public Safety, Inspections, & Enforcement
jobDescripton: The Transportation Planning & Management Division seeks ambitions and motivated Street Ambassador Team Leader to assist in the coordination of community outreach to support the Transportation Planning & Management Divisionâ€™s portfolio.  Cited in the Agencyâ€™s Strategic Plan, the Street Ambassador program has been critical to the Agencyâ€™s public engagement strategy â€“ providing the capacity for public input in the Street Improvement Project development process and supporting the explicit goals of Project-Based Outreach and Public Awareness.  Duties include supervising a team of full-time staff and interns, planning, implementing, coordinating, monitoring and evaluating Street Ambassador deployments, making recommendations on policies and procedures, providing technical assistance and training to subordinate staff, preparing evaluation reports, performing analyses and reviewing program plans, funding and performance.  The Division of Transportation Planning and Management is responsible for the safe, efficient and environmentally responsible movement of people and goods on the City's streets, supporting the larger goals of economic and social vitality for people living, working and doing business in New York City.  The Divisionâ€™s responsibilities include planning, street design, technical analysis, signs, transit development, freight mobility and markings, ensuring the safety of motor vehicle occupants, pedestrians, and cyclists.
minQualRequirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to the duties described above; or  2. High school graduation or equivalent and six years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to the duties as described above; or  3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least one year of experience as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: Preference given to candidates who have experience both working and coordinating an Ambassador role or similar. Candidates should have experience leading teams, developing outreach plans, daily reporting, project documentation, and survey development. Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office, SurveyMonkey, Adobe Suite, and some GIS.
additionalInformation: Applicants should excel in communicating with the public, have an interest in DOTâ€™s current initiatives, and have capacity to quickly adapt to new project requests. Creativity is encouraged. Professional and positive attitude and the ability to take direction and feedback from various sources is needed.  All scheduling will be set in advance, but flexibility is expected. In order to conduct effective outreach, work-week schedules are either Sunday through Thursday or Tuesday through Saturday during the outreach season. Winter schedules are Monday through Friday. Shifts will be staggered to include some early morning or evening events.  This position is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a program.  Please indicate in your resume or cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a program.

jobCategory: Engineering, Architecture, & Planning Policy, Research & Analysis
jobDescripton: Freight Mobility (FM) seeks a self-motivated, detail-oriented team player who will serve as a Freight Planner.  The selected candidate will be responsible for supporting sustainable and efficient freight initiatives emanating from the Smart Truck Management Plan, a strategic freight strategy, and supporting OneNYC 2050: the Cityâ€™s Green New Deal goals. The candidate will report to Deputy Director of Freight Programs, Education and Research, coordinate with other Transportation Planning & Management (TPM) units, and be expected to work collaboratively and inclusively, seeking to cultivate continued professional development and effectively communicate with all stakeholders. The Freight Mobility unit is responsible for advancing policies and programs that mitigate the adverse impacts of trucks on communities and infrastructure, while also improving truck delivery efficiency with an overall mission of supporting the Cityâ€™s economic competitiveness. The Alternative Fuels Program collaborates with FM in increasing the adoption of clean vehicles and fuels, and with the industry to improve the environmental impacts of goods movement within New York City (NYC). The Freight Planner will perform the following tasks: Support freight demand management programs and initiatives, including the expansion of the Off Hour Deliveries (OHD) program, a Mayoral priority announced in April 2019 as part of a suite of OneNYC 2050 transportation mobility measures which seeks to increase the number of deliveries between 7 pm and 6 am within congested areas of NYC. Key tasks include targeted business outreach, education and program enrollment, working with businesses to implement change management plans and developing program performance metrics. Expand Sustainable Freight Initiatives: The candidate will support the Alternative Fuels Program in coordinating targeted outreach strategies to the trucking industry and businesses within Industrial Business Zones. The candidate will support the expansion of the NYC Clean Truck Program, an initiative to promote sustainable transportation and a cleaner environment by engaging with truck owners. The NYC Clean Truck Program offers rebate incentives to purchase advanced transportation technologies and alternative fuels such as new diesel, hybrid electric, compressed natural gas, and battery electric trucks with safety features such as side guards that advance the Cityâ€™s Vision Zero goals. Coordination of Freight Transportation Planning Program Elements: The candidate will serve as the freight mobility coordinator in the metropolitan planning organization (MPO) process to assist in the coordination of local, state and regional planning activities. The candidate will support the New York Metropolitan Planning Councilâ€™s transportation planning program freight initiatives, including but not limited to updating of the Regional Transportation Plan 2050 and the Regional Freight Plan 2045 implementation to ensure compliance with federal and state planning requirements.   The successful candidate must be able to work as part of an interdisciplinary team and display independent initiative and judgment, coordinating community and stakeholder outreach, generate data-driven analyses. The candidate will be expected to prepare standard reports, presentations, and effectively communicate analyses and results.
minQualRequirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college with a major in engineering, urban studies, panning, mathematics or one of the physical sciences; or    2. A high school graduation or its equivalent and 4 years of full-time experience performing technical work on city-wide highway transportation studies and traffic programs; or    3. Education and/or experience equivalent to "1" or "2" above.
preferredSkills: The candidate must possess knowledge of the technical aspects of transportation infrastructure and planning; the ability to think and act strategically, and experience analyzing, interpreting, and communicating transportation performance issues; strong data analysis, report writing, and experience using MS Office Suite, Arc GIS, and Adobe Suite. Knowledge of traffic analysis software is highly preferred. A valid Driverâ€™s License is a plus.
additionalInformation: This position is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a program.  Please indicate in your resume or cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a program.

jobDescripton: NYC Department of Finance (DOF) is responsible for administering the tax revenue laws of the city fairly, efficiently, and transparently to instill public confidence and encourage compliance while providing exceptional customer service.  The Office of External Affairs is responsible for all internal and external communications. This includes the press office, social media, the agency editor/speechwriter, correspondence, outreach, intergovernmental/legislative affairs, and the web unit.  The External Affairs Division has an excellent opportunity available for an experienced professional to serve as the agency's Press Officer.   As the main point of contact for community-based, citywide and national media, the Press Officer plays a key role in fulfilling the Department of Finance's mission.  Whether responding to an acute crisis or advancing a new initiative, the agency relies on the Press Officer to convey vital information to the public.  The Press Officer will oversee the agency's public relations activities, ensure effective communication with stakeholders, other government agencies, the media and public.   Reporting to the Assistant Commissioner for External Affairs, the selected candidate's responsibilities will include, but are not limited to the following:   â€¢	Manage day-to-day operations of the press office, supervise staff and plan, develop and implement strong media strategies and advertisement for agency's initiatives. â€¢	Research, write and edit articles for newsletters, press releases, and other written materials. â€¢	Advise the Commissioner and other senior staff on how to effectively present agency information.  â€¢	Build and maintain positive relationships with key stakeholders, including members of the media and other City government agencies.  Represent the agency at press conferences. â€¢	Coordinate the agency's response to press inquiries, ranging from complex operational matters to sensitive issues affecting the administration's public image. â€¢	Disseminate accurate, high-quality information about agency initiatives. â€¢	Respond rapidly to numerous media inquiries. â€¢	Work closely and professionally with program staff to collect information pertinent to reporters' inquiries and make the information understandable to journalist and the public. â€¢	Provide training to prepare agency staff to handle print, TV and radio interviews. â€¢	Prepare reports and presentations.
minQualRequirements: 1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and five (5) years of satisfactory responsible full-time paid experience in public relations, journalism, or a related field; or"  2. A satisfactory equivalent. However, all candidates must have at least one (1) year of experience as described in "1" above.
preferredSkills: â€¢	At least 5 years of press and media experience with demonstrated progressive career in press relations and understanding of primary social media platforms. â€¢	Ability to make technical information easy for journalists and the public to understand. â€¢	Ability to use sound judgment in high-pressure situations and handle multiple deadline assignments in a quickly changing environment. â€¢	Sensitive to political context and ability to work effectively with diverse constituencies at all levels. â€¢	Excellent organizational, management, leadership, and analytic skills. â€¢	Proficient in MS Office Suite. â€¢	Knowledge of City government is a plus.
additionalInformation: In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

jobDescripton: New York City Emergency Management (NYCEM) helps New Yorkers before, during, and after emergencies through preparedness, education, and response. NYCEM is responsible for coordinating citywide emergency planning and response for all types and scales of emergencies. We are staffed by more than 200 dedicated professionals with diverse backgrounds and areas of expertise, including individuals assigned from other City agencies.  The Accounts Payable Unit handles end-of-year closeouts, reconciliation of fiscal year budget; and supports travel .   New York City Emergency Management (NYC EM) is looking for an innovative person with a background in accounts payable/receivable, budgeting, or other administrative work to join its Finance Unit. The accounts payable coordinator will be responsible for providing assistance with all aspects of accounts payable as well as providing general administrative support to the unit.    Duties include:  â€¢	Assisting with all aspects of accounts payable  â€¢	Collecting and organizing necessary paperwork to process payment including opening and date stamping all incoming mail â€¢	Performing accounts payable and budget actions in NYCâ€™s Financial Management System (FMS) â€¢	Creating payment voucher for level three (3) approval â€¢	Communicate with vendors â€¢	General administrative work including scanning, copying, and file management â€¢	Assisting with out of town travels and reconciliation of end of the month travel statement â€¢	Assisting with placing order for EOC activation or meeting request  The selected candidate will be assigned to an Emergency Operations Center (EOC) team, and will be expected to work non-business hours during emergency activations. The selected candidate will also participate in drills and exercises, assist with Ready NY presentations, and will undertake special projects as assigned.
minQualRequirements: 1. A masterâ€™s degree from an accredited college in emergency management, public administration, urban planning, engineering, economics, political science, the physical sciences or related field and one year of satisfactory full-time professional experience in one or a combination of the following: emergency management, fire, police, or military service, public safety, public health, public administration, urban planning, engineering, or another specialized area to which the appointment is to be made; or  2.
